title: How it feels to play a fed Darius

replies.body: There is no "I" in team, but there is one in Darius.
There is no "I" in team, but there is an "I" in DIE
there's gonna be a "me" in that ahri

How it really feels 

{{item:3070}} {{champion:122}} {{item:3070}}
Kiting at its finest.
Just don't let him poke you.
Dat perfect gif though, on that note, I remember the first time I saw this scene in theaters, I missed what Hulk said because everyone was laughing too hard.
"Puny God" best hulk ever!
Me too! I thought he said "Demi-God" in theaters. Everyone was laughing for a *very* long time. One of the best moments in any Superhero movie.
How does it feel playing a fed Darius and never getting to anyone and not getting to use all of that damage you have an pretty much get turned into a bad tank with no/mediocre initiation
Yeah... until you *do* reach someone. Then you go all smash jam and dunk their sad faces.
They can only run so far until you take all their structures. They can't defend their Nexus from the fountain.

How does it feel to have a team with cc who enables you?

You must not know.
or you know that 430-440 move speed you have cause of switfies, trin and one move speed quint ;3

Certainly T champions in a nutshell.
Darius isn't even that bad. At least Darius has very clearly exploitable weaknesses.
Such as?
Kiting

kiting isn't a weakness when you have any amount of tanks on your team kiddo.

I hope all certainlyT champs get gutted to hell and never played again so that he actually learns how to balance his champion on the drawing board
instead of 1-5 years after its released

Being slightly less broken than other champs doesn't make them balanced btw.
Just so you know.

How is Darius broken? 

Someone has to fulfill "if they're in my melee range, I kill them" niche, and Mordekaiser apparently isn't allowed to fit that bill. Because of the nature of "If you're in my very limited range, you die" kit, he's a natural lane bully to other melees. Thing is: Kiting and minimal damage outside of melee range are very real weaknesses, and a tank can't always be there to patch it up for you. Just ask Jayce and Kayle how much they worry about a Darius -- especially in the laning phase. Oh, you want a melee that beats him? Yorick and Mantheon, with Jax going even with him. 

A weakness is always a weakness, even if it isn't always a bleeding ulcer a la Spain to Napoleon. For every tank that can enable that Darius, there's someone that can disengage and make the tank's efforts futile and further prevent harm from being done by Darius. He really isn't broken. He's a lane bully and he's damn good at what he does - why is that apparently not allowed to exist in this game and called broken almost every time it shows up?

I was with 3 friends in a normal game. And the 5th first picks Darius. Our response was forming the comp around Darius going all ham in teamfights.

You don't know the fear of a Darius with a 99% speed boost when your team is hit by a {{champion:54}} ult. Its scary.

a champ that can 1v1 anyone else in the game including garen should not be able to easily catch people. if you die as darius early no worries you just hit lvl 6 and dunk them. if you die against darius early.... may god have mercy on your soul

He's has a low CD on his jump, and he can 1v1 anyone except a stacked {{champion:75}} and maybe {{champion:78}} .

Yep. Jax is super easy to completely shut down in lane if your using a lane bully like Darius. I mean shut him down so hard he'll be 0/8 before 12 minutes.

He can beat Nasus until he gets to about 250 stacks, which should take no more than 15 minutes. He can beat Jax until about 10-15 minutes, then they go even, then Jax starts winning. Assuming they don't do anything stupid and feed. He just plain counters Poppy, not much to be said there.

And I used Jax as an example because you said a good duelist shouldn't be sticky, well there ya go lol.
